channel.title: How much for a decent computer?
channel.description:
I have a really old computer (2003?) and it can't play any modern games; it barely runs CS:S l0l.
I'm just curious, how much would a decent computer, doesn't have to be awesome.. just decent enough to run modern games (idk like Call of Duty, etc) comfortably? Or.... could I upgrade my current computer? I'll post the hardware I have once I get home as I'm on my iPhone at the moment.

item.title: How much for a decent computer?
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:17, topic:388038”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=483858.msg3551516#msg3551516 date=1301568286]

I would recommend just buying a new computer, preferably 64-bit if you plan on gaming.
[/quote]um, since when are new cpu’s sold that aren’t 64-bit?

Just look in Wallmart… Also how the fuck does NewEgg manage to sell everything so cheap?[/quote]
They buy things in bulk

Read full topic
item.source: How much for a decent computer?

item.title: How much for a decent computer?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:14, topic:388038”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=483858.msg3552031#msg3552031 date=1301610286]

[quote author=Unhandled link=topic=483858.msg3551955#msg3551955 date=1301606200]

I would recommend just buying a new computer, preferably 64-bit if you plan on gaming.
[/quote]um, since when are new cpu’s sold that aren’t 64-bit?

more importantly, since when are games written for 64 bit?
[/quote]Since 2006-2007.

Maybe he should have said most games, or even games (except for crysis)[/quote]Um, most games since that period have both 64-bit and 32-bit binaries.

Read full topic

item.title: How much for a decent computer?
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

I would recommend just buying a new computer, preferably 64-bit if you plan on gaming.

I’m going to get a new HP Pavilion, for $349.99. 500GB hard drive. It’s powered with an AMD Athlon II 220 dual-core processor and 4GB system memory. So I’d assume you can get a good computer for fairly a cheap price, right?

Read full topic

item.title: How much for a decent computer?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Newegg doesn’t ship to australia.

Whirlpool keeps builds updated for different budgets and bases their prices off msy. They are good bang for buck but they also spend the money where it counts such as power supply. It’s probably the best builds/prices you’ll be able to get in australia. If you don’t live near msy than umart would be the second choice.

http://whirlpool.net.au/wiki/rmp_sg_whirlpoolpcs_gaming_configs

Read full topic

item.title: How much for a decent computer?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

This is what I built, you probably need a case/psu and a video card as well, but I already had those:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/builds/moparisthebest.html (I went with the Asus mobo)

You could use those parts from what I put together for Newty to buy:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:385664”]Ok, here it is:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/builds/newty.html

Total:
$494.94
$9.99 shipping
you get $20 back from a mail in rebate
1 free 4GB kingston flashdrive
2 free games (Just Cause 2 + Mafia)

Plus it’s an awesome computer! The case is ugly, but you can pick a better looking one for about the same price. The power supply that comes with it most likely sucks, but when it goes out you can order one for $40 or so. It also leaves some empty slots to add extra RAM in the future, but 4GB is plenty for now. It supports up to 16.

You can also save money going with a smaller hard drive or not one at all if you have an old computer to harvest from. Anyway, that’s what I’d build, and thanks a lot asshole, because now I want to order it :P[/quote][quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:385664”]I also found better/cheaper RAM:

newegg.com

CORSAIR XMS3 4GB (2 x 2GB) 240-Pin DDR3 SDRAM DDR3 1600 (PC3...

Buy CORSAIR XMS3 4GB (2 x 2GB) 240-Pin DDR3 SDRAM DDR3 1600 (PC3 12800) Desktop Memory Model CMX4GX3M2A1600C9 with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Newegg shopping upgraded ™


Only $29.99 after mail in rebate. :)[/quote]

Read full topic
